snippet: For most of the last decade, Southern Californians have struggled through drought. This week they are coping with the opposite problem: the worst flooding in decades.   The rain storms have closed freeways, sent millions of gallons of raw sewage i...
lead_paragraph: For most of the last decade, Southern Californians have struggled through drought. This week they are coping with the opposite problem: the worst flooding in decades. The rain storms have closed freeways, sent millions of gallons of raw sewage into the Pacific, washed out canyon roads, flooded trailer parks and contributed to the death of at least seven people.

headline.main: New California Storm Brings Worst Floods in Decades
